alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 6:16PM MST until September 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR AREAS IN AND AROUND THE PIPELINE FIRE SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 612 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Upper Schultz Creek and White Horse Canyon. Up to 0.9 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar has resuledt in debris flow per the Government Tank Wash Webc camera. Flows will remain possible along Schultz Creek, Chimney Wash, Upper Government Tank, Peaceful Way, Lenox-Wupatki Trails . The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Debris flows. SOURCE...Radar, Gauge, and Web Cameras. IMPACT...Debris flows in and around the Pipeline Fire Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Inner Basin Pumphouse, Agassiz Peak, Humphreys Peak, Locket Meadow CG, Schultz Pass, Sugarloaf Mountain, Dry Lake Hills, Abineau Canyon Trailhead, Mt Elden Estates, Cheshire and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Upper Schultz Creek and White Horse Canyon. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain.
